fields.description:
h1. Symptoms

Please, check out this script:

{code}<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">

<jira:CreateUser username="test001" password="test001" confirm="test001" fullname="test001" email="test001@example.com" />
<jira:RemoveUser name="test001" />

<jira:CreateUser username="test002" password="test002" confirm="test002" fullname="test002" email="test002@example.com" />
<jira:RemoveUser name="test002" />

</JiraJelly>{code}

It's supposed to work like a charm, creating two new users and removing these soon after. However, it simply doesn't work. The first user is created and removed fine, but the second one is created but not removed. Also, the following exception is thrown on the screen:

!jelly_fail.png!

There's no reference for this error.

h1. Workaround

Change the order of the tags inside the script. Firstly, dispose all CreateUser tasks and only after the RemoveUser ones. Taking in consideration the sample above:

{code}<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">

<jira:CreateUser username="test001" password="test001" confirm="test001" fullname="test001" email="test001@example.com" />
<jira:CreateUser username="test002" password="test002" confirm="test002" fullname="test002" email="test002@example.com" />

<jira:RemoveUser name="test001" />
<jira:RemoveUser name="test002" />

</JiraJelly>{code}

Please, advice soon.
fields.summary: Jelly Runner crashes if there's a RemoveUser tag between two CreateUser

fields.description:
While editing an issue, if you try to update the Fix Version (or any other field using a multi-selection Combo widget) by deleting the current selection, you'll notice that the keyboard focus isn't granted to this field. There is no focus anywhere, the focus should be in the field you just deleted an option from.

Reproduction:
1) Open a browser window to an issue and then edit it
2) Don't click or type anywhere on the issue yet...
3) Look at the affected versions field (again without typing/clicking).
4) You should see something like "VersionName [X]". (where VersionName is the one assigned when you created it)
5) Click once the [X] to remove the version from the affected versions
6) There is no focus, it should be in the field
fields.summary: Deleting a choice from a multi-select does not focus the field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25092].
  {panel}

If you attempt to search JIRA issues for special characters (in text fields), using properly escaped special character syntax (see [our documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-EscapingSpecialCharactersor] on *Escaping Special Characters* when performing text searches for details), *no results* are retrieved, even when JIRA issues containing these characters (in the relevant text fields) actually do exist.

It seems this problem is a bug (and that this functionality should exist in JIRA) because when you attempt to perform a Simple or Quick search like:
{code}
\[
{code}
and you switch to Advanced search, this search term gets resolved to the properly escaped JQL syntax:
{code}
summary ~ "\\[" OR description ~ "\\[" OR comment ~ "\\["
{code}

Further to this it's been found that not only escaping [ does not work, but other characters don't escape correctly.

----

We tested the following special characters in [our documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-EscapingSpecialCharactersor] only to find that most of them do not work:
{code}
one+ two- three& four| five! six( seven) eight{ nine} ten[ eleven] twelve^ thirteen~ fifteen* sixteen? seventeen\
{code}
Doing special character searches have the following problems with escaping:
{code}
summary ~ "one\\+" (works)
summary ~ "two\\-" (works)
summary ~ "three\\&" (works)
summary ~ "four\\|" (works)
summary ~ "five\\!" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "six\\(" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "seven\\)" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "eight\\{" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "nine\\}" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "ten\\[" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "eleven\\]" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "twelve\\^" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "thirteen\\~" (works)
summary ~ "fifteen\\*" (works)
summary ~ "sixteen\\?" (doesn't work)
summary ~ "seventeen\u005C" (doesn't work) (special case where \\\ does not work either)
{code}
fields.summary: Searching JIRA issues for special characters (in text fields) does not work, even if these characters have been properly escaped in a quick, simple or advanced (i.e. JQL) search.

fields.description:
When importing the issues with a zip file, the importer handles all metadata correctly (structure correct). Unfortunately, the user-texts (comments, descriptions) will stored with an invalid charset -- or were wrong converted. See attached image.

Trac's default charset is set to "iso-8859-15". 

My suggested solution:
 1. Add a source-conversion dropdown into the wizard. I think this would solve the issue.
fields.summary: Trac-Importer parses issues with wrong charset

fields.description:
There is already an entry on "answers.atlassian.com", but it seems still unresolved: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/1602/date-from-trac-not-importing-correctly

Under some circumstances the trac importer does not correctly parse dates/events from trac.

Summarized: The actual problem is, that the trac schema was changed internally at a point x. Before, the timestamp is in seconds; after, the timestamp is in microseconds. The result is that all timestamps are "1970-01-01".

My suggested solutions:
 1. Add a configuration property "timestamp type" right into the wizard.
fields.summary: Trac-Importer parses dates incorrectly

fields.description:
We found enumeration of usernames to be possible in Jira 4.3.4 despite the login failure message not revealing whether it was the username or password that was incorrect.

After 3 failed login attempts a captcha appears only if the user exists, otherwise not. This allows an attacker to enumerate the usernames.

Security issue found by Asbjørn Reglund Thorsen <a.r.thorsen@usit.uio.no> and Geir Harald Hansen <g.h.hansen@usit.uio.no>
fields.summary: Enumeration of usernames possible in Jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25070].
  {panel}

The 'initial transition' (aka the 'Create Issue' transition') is a special type of transition that's available in all newly created JIRA workflows (as well as copies of the default workflow), which is activated when the user creates an issue and leads to the first step of an issue's workflow.

When you add a transition to any workflow in JIRA, JIRA automatically adds 5 'essential post functions' to that transition, which cannot be deleted.

On the other hand, a workflow's 'initial transition' only has 2 'essential post functions':
* One of which is 1 of the 5 'essential post functions' (required for other transitions)
* The other of which is unique to any workflow's 'initial transition'.

However, you can add the remaining 4 'essential post functions' (required for other transitions) to the 'initial transition', as 'optional post functions'. However, once they've been added, they cannot be removed.

Please ensure a 'Delete' link is available on these 'optional post functions' for the 'initial transition' as they are not 'essential post functions' in this context.

See this page for a workaround for JIRA server: [How to remove optional post functions from the initial transition in a workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+remove+optional+post+functions+from+the+initial+transition+in+a+workflow]

h3.Applicable Workaround for cloud:
- Create a new project as a new standard workflow
- Add the workflow to the workflow scheme for the project
- Change the workflow scheme for the project to use the new workflow
- Migrate existing issues to new project using bulk move
- delete the old workflow
fields.summary: You cannot delete / remove optional post functions which have been added to the 'initial transition' (i.e. 'Create' transition) of a JIRA workflow.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25062].
  {panel}

Try to HTTP GET *anonymously* from /api/2.0.alpha1/component/{id}/relatedIssueCounts, where id is any an id of any component which is not accessible anonymously.

You would get NOT_FOUND whereas the error message suggests something different: "This user does not have permission to complete this operation."
It's obvious with this error message that such resource exists.
Two solutions:
- use UNAUTHORIZED when the resource is accessed anonymously and the person has no access to view it. (this is preferred IMO as in many places for anonymous attempts to access something we should ask person to authenticate first)
- change error message so that it does not indicate that the resource exists

When an authenticated attempt is made but the user is not authorized to see given component, then more correctly 404 is returned and the error message "The user XXX does not have permission to complete this operation." In such case sending UNAUTHORIZED does not make sense. So this part looks good.
fields.summary: HTTP error codes are used inconsistently by components resource

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25061].
  {panel}

"Recently Created Chart" gadget with weekly period displays issues created on 11-13 July in week 29, but the week 29 starts on 18 July.
h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new project and create some issues in it
# Add a Recently Created Chart in a dashboard. Configure it to point to the project and set its *Period* to *Weekly*

h4. Expected Results

The chart shows the issues being created in the correct week

h4. Actual Results

The newly created issues are shown in the wrong Week, specifically it shows it being created one week ahead

+Some screenshots:+
* Here are 6 issues created on 26th Jan 2016: [^JQL.png]
* Here's a date picker showing the correct week for 26th Jan 2016, which is the 4th week: [^DueDate.png]
* Here's the Recently Created gadget showing the 6 issues created, in *week 5* instead of week 4: [^RecentlyCreated.png]

h4. Notes

This also affects the Created vs. Resolved report/gadget
fields.summary: Recently Created Chart with weekly period shows issues shifted forwards by one week

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 25th February 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi all,

We have recognised that while we have provided some functionality to rename _screenshots_ while being attached to a JIRA ticket, this isn't a great user experience and missed the point for what many of you are asking for.

We agree that this is something that should be changed and because of this, I am reopening this suggestion. I must remind everyone this isn't a guarantee that this suggestion will be done immediately, however we would like to be open that implementing this would be the right thing to do.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

----


Hi,

After we have uploaded the attachment file to the issue, we would like to rename the attachment file name.
Can you please create a new feature in JIRA so that we can rename the attachment file?

and

An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. 
Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getCustomFieldValue' in

This is a regression caused by the performance improvements made in Dashboards for 4.3.

A special resource was created in AJS that only included js/css required for the rendering of gadgets (com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs-gadgets). The autocomplete resource depends on this. 

The problem occurs when you then use autocomplete in conjuction with a resource that depends on the full version of AUI. This results in two version of AJS being added to the gadget. This causes a wide range of issues.

I recently read Sarah M and Bruces posts about using a task and subtasks as a clone template for repeated tasks.  

http://ffeathers.wordpress.com/2011/04/12/jira-cloning-to-create-a-template-for-repeated-documentation-tasks/

And it got me thinking that we could offer variable replacement during clone to make it even more powerful.

In Sarahs examples she has Confluence X.X in each issue that she then needs to edit

What if we could replace them automatically

Something like ${version} becomes the value of a "version" variable at clone time.

I would change the clone dialog to allow a row of variable definitions.  We could track those variables per person so they dont have to re-enter them over time. 

This would make cloning even more powerful and powerful.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Log in to JIRA via SOAP client
# Notice the SOAP session created and visible in JIRA Administration > System > User Sessions
# Log out from JIRA (via SOAP client)
# SOAP session still there
# Terminate the program
# SOAP session still there even after more than half an hour.

I am not sure if this is SOAP bug or if the User Sessions window does not retrieve the latest information. Either way, I believe it is a bug, as User Sessions states that it displays the current user sessions.

h3. Impact analysis
If SOAP sessions are not terminated after a SOAP logout, it is considered a wasted resource (or you may call it inefficiency in JIRA) to have an unused open socket connection in JIRA server.

Regards,
Ali
fields.summary: JIRA SOAP session appears open even after SOAP client logs out and terminates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25031].
  {panel}

h3. Issue Summary
If you have a Post Function in your workflow that sets the remaining estimate to zero, and have a post function that will clear the remaining estimate to zero, it will change the original estimate to zero too.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Switch to Legacy Time Tracking Mode
# Add a Post Function to your projects workflow that will set just the remaining estimate to 0m, not the original estimate.
# Create a new issue with an Original Estimate of 5h
# Close the issue and log 1 hour of work on the close screen, automatically adjust remaining estimate.

h3. Expected Results
Isue will be closed with a an Original Estimate of 5h.

h3. Actual Results
It will now have a Original Estimate of 0m.

h3. Workaround
Create the issue, log work and as a separate step close the issue.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Legacy Mode and Workflow Post Functions Error

fields.description:
Lets say you have two directories in JIRA: a crowd directory and the internal directory. Further lets say you have [crowd sso|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Integrating+Crowd+with+Atlassian+JIRA] configured in JIRA.

Now lets say you want you edit the crowd directory in JIRA (e.g. change it from read to read/write). You can't do this as a user from the directory because JIRA wont let you. Normally you would login as and admin from the internal directory and edit the crowd directory. However, as the crowd sso authenticator only allows users from a crowd directory to login. This basically means you can't change the configuration of the crowd directory.

The way to work around this is disable crowd sso (i.e. edit seraph-config.xml) and restart JIRA. This will the admin login using a user from the internal directory which will in turn let them edit the crowd directory.
fields.summary: Hard to edit crowd directory when using the Crowd SSO authenticator.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25023].
  {panel}

Story: plugin developers want to create plugins with lots of features. Most plugins use Velocity templates for their UI features.

Problem: Velocity files in JIRA can use #parse and #macro to make them scale better. Plugins can't use #parse at all, and #macro only works within the same .vm file. 
This makes it hard for plugins to scale. Developing and debugging a large, monolithic .vm file is hard to get right.

Idea: modify the DefaultVelocityManager so that when it is used by a plugin it changes the Velocity engine properties and adds the resources directory as a valid TEMPLATE_ROOT for finding macros and .vm files to include. Document this with a small reference plugin that shows how to use these Velocity features to improve your own plugin.
fields.summary: Make Velocity files scale better for plugins

fields.description:
Running JIRA on Tomcat with other Atlassian Applications on the same Tomcat is not recommended. This is nicely stated in these documentations:

* [Running JIRA on Tomcat 6.0|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA043/Installing+JIRA+on+Tomcat+6.0#InstallingJIRAonTomcat6.0-BeforeYouBegin]
* [Running JIRA on Tomcat 5.5|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+on+Tomcat+5.5]

Moreover, running JIRA on Tomcat with any other applications is actually not recommended, especially if these applications are large or if they require libraries installed under <tomcat>/lib, as this may cause false positive XSRF attacks which is described in this link:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/%27XSRF+white+list+failure%27+When+Editing+Workflows

In order to prevent possibility of such problems, I believe we should mention this in our documentation besides it being mentioned in our knowledge base article.

This is the part where it would be suitable to change/add to, from our Running JIRA on Tomcat documentations:
{quote}
Deploying multiple Atlassian applications in a single Tomcat container is not supported. We do not test this configuration and upgrading any of the applications (even for point releases) is likely to break it. There are also a number of known issues with this configuration (see this FAQ for more information).

We also strongly recommend that you do not deploy multiple Atlassian applications in a single Tomcat container for a number of practical reasons. Firstly, you will need to shut down Tomcat to upgrade any application and secondly, if one application crashes, the other applications running in the Tomcat container will be inaccessible.
{quote}

To summarize, we should also say that it is not recommended to run any applications on the same Tomcat instance besides JIRA, especially if they are large in terms of memory or require additional libraries in <tomcat>/lib.

Regards,
Ali
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Documentation improvement on running JIRA on Tomcat

project = GPROJECTS AND reporter = "user@apple.com" AND status != Closed AND issuetype in (Project) AND cf[10053]="cf12" ORDER BY summary ASC, key DESC

A similar new feature request has been resolved as won't fix, but the reasoning for the "won't fix" determination has a problem with it.

It is pointed out in the won't fix resolution that the Links Hierarchy plugin covers the functionality requested, but it does not for the following reason. The "blocks" links typically form a directed-acyclic-graph, not a tree. A DAG can have the following structure:

{noformat}
       C 
      / \
 A - B   E - F 
      \ /
       D
{noformat}

The Links Hierarchy Plug-in does not handle this case well. It shows multiples of E and F, one hanging off C and one off D.

PERT charts are a long-established and valuable project issue/task dependency management tool, and JIRA needs one.
I will be forced to hand-copy my issues into Visio bubbles and arrows until this feature happens in JIRA.
fields.summary: Directed-Acyclic-Graph view of blocks links to create PERT chart

fields.description:
My team members need to be able to associate their vote for a specific issue with a target version in the Unreleased Versions category.

For example, suppose I find a bug in version 1.1, and that I have multiple potential Fix Versions:
* 1.1.1
* 1.2
* 2.0

I want users to be able to vote for the issue to be targeted to a particular version (i.e. "I vote for the bug to be fixed in version 1.2").  This data could be rolled up to help the product owner make a decision.
fields.summary: Allow votes to be associated with an Unreleased Version

fields.description:
h3. Example steps to reproduce:
# Clone the original workflow
# Open the Workflow Designer for the cloned workflow
# Use the transition tool to create a transition from Open to Open statuses. A popup window will appear with 3 options on top.
!allows using Create Issue as transition.png!
# Choose *Clone Transition* (or *Use Common Transition*. These are the two options that expose this bug). Choose Create Issue transition in that window.
# Click Ok. Stack trace with class cast exception appears

h3. Proposed solution
Workflow Designer should never allow cloning or re-using Create Issue as transition.

h3. Current workaround
Prevention. Do not choose Create Issue as transition from anywhere

h3. Impact analysis
As far as I could see. Choosing Create issue will not cause serious trouble, except that the Workflow Designer will hang upon the next operation (see sub-task of this bug). In that case the Workflow Designer will need to be re-loaded.

Regards,
Ali
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: JIRA 4.4 workflow designer allows choosing Create Issue as transition through "Clone Transition" and "Use Common Transition" options, which will eventually crash the workflow designer

As part of my induction for JIRA support i've gone through the 4.4 installer guide and here's some feedback I've got. I've formatted so that the link to the page is followed by the issue I'm discussing.



http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+Java
- linux commands for setting JAVA_HOME missing (though this could be because of differences in distro) But I found that this is pretty standard...
echo JAVA_HOME="</PATH/TO/JAVA>" >> /etc/environment



http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Standalone+from+an+Archive+File+on+Windows%2C+Linux+or+Solaris

Can we make a note and link that using the .bin file is recommended over doing it manually from the archive file


1. Download and Extract the JIRA Standalone Archive File

This did not suggest where to put JIRA in the first place, though I understand if this is purposeful... we could say something like this if we thought it necessary.
mkdir -p /opt/atlassian/jira
mv *.tar.gz /opt/atlassian/jira
cd /opt/atlassian/jira
tar xfvz atlassian-jira-4.4-*.tar.gz
ln -s atlassian-jira-4.4-BLAH current


2. Set the JIRA Home Directory in JIRA

Can we have the path of application.properties without having to click for it?
./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties

Only a small thing but I think it's more of a convention to use </suggested/paths> as such.
export JIRA_HOME = </path/to/jira/home>
Can we give an example that it's usually set as something like /var/atlassian/jira ?

I think exporting can be risky because the system will forget it when logged out and in again. Instead maybe something like:
echo JIRA_HOME=/var/atlassian/jira >> /etc/environment



3. Create a Dedicated User Account on the Operating System to Run JIRA

Can we suggest a dedicated user account AND group?

groupadd atlassian
Then add the user jira and put it into the group atlassian:
useradd --create-home --comment "Account for running JIRA" --shell /bin/bash jira -G atlassian

Suggestion for setting permissions
chown -R jira:atlassian </path/to/jira/install>
chmod 770 </path/to/jira/install> (please tighten for security if necessary)
chown -R jira:atlassian </path/to/jira/home>
chmod 770 </path/to/jira/home> (please tighten for security if necessary)


4. Start JIRA

Wait until the following message appears in the application's log file: - give path to log file instead of having to click elsewhere.

If JIRA does not appear in your web browser, you may need to change the port that JIRA runs on.
Also suggest to check OS and network firewalls


http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+the+Setup+Wizard

Can we please link to a page on dragons (or wherever) that tells the customer how to set up on different databases eg: postgres...

Basic Postgres setup information:
yum install postgresql84-libs.x86_64 postgresql84-server.x86_64 postgresql84-devel.x86_64
su postgres
initdb /var/lib/pgsql/data
* check postgresql.conf 
(adjust security)
listen_addresses = '*'  
* check pg_hba.conf
(adjust security)
host    all         all       0.0.0.0/0               trust
exit
/etc/init.d/postgresql start
su postgres
createuser jira_user
Shall the new role be a superuser? (y/n) n
Shall the new role be allowed to create databases? (y/n) y
Shall the new role be allowed to create more new roles? (y/n) n
CREATE ROLE
$ /usr/local/pgsql/bin/createdb jira_db -O jira_user
CREATE DATABASE
test database and enable password:
psql postgres postgres
\l (lists all databases)
ALTER USER postgres WITH PASSWORD 'tmppassword';



http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+PostgreSQL#ConnectingJIRAtoPostgreSQL-databaseconfig

Open a console and execute config.sh in the bin subdirectory of the JIRA Installation Directory.
Can we make a note that the costumer will need a GUI on Linux for this.



http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Standalone+on+Linux

I thought that the name was a little generic "Installing JIRA Standalone on Linux" 
Maybe can we change it to something like "Installing JIRA Standalone on Linux using self extracting setup wizard"?
Reiterate that this will be the recommended way to perform an install

 If JIRA does not appear, you may need to change the port that JIRA runs on.
 pelase add "Also check OS and network firewalls blocking your chosen port"

fields.description:
webwork.util.ValueStack has a static cache of Method's keyed by Class, and will cache the Class of any ww value you call findValue on, pretty much.

We should call ValueStack.clearMethods() fairly aggressively, at least on plugin disable/enablement.
fields.summary: webwork's ValueStack caches class objects, preventing the GC of a plugin's classloader

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

I need a dashboard gadget and I can't figure out how to create it. The style should be similar to 'Greenhopper Days Remaining' - Big Bold Number. 

The information it should provide relates to Service Level Agreement commitment projections based on historical data. This concept is especially used with Kanban processes, where a commitment is made as a new task starts, that it will be complete within <statistic> days. 

The commitment is based on the (recent) historical mean for the cycle time (ie."work started" - to - "done" period) for issues [of that type] PLUS 2 standard deviations. 

The problem I am striking is that JQL seems too primitive to allow me to select an appropriate set of records and perform statistical calculations based on values for certain fields in those records.

What is needed is:
Where Project is <name>
  Pick the (configurable number) most recently "Closed" or "Resolved" issues
    For these issues, calculate the mean and standard deviation from the time difference between the "work started" and "done" timestamps
      Display = Mean + (2 * Sigma)

Of course this would also be best with additional filtering, so the set of issues calculated over would be taken from a selected Component or Version or Assignee. As we are using 'shirt size' estimates via a custom field, it would be good to filter based on that also, so that we can have a gadget that displays the current SLA commitment for each estimation size.

An additional option to display the actual mean would be useful also.

I attach suggested graphic and config mockups
fields.summary: New Gadget for SLA Commitment Period based on recent historical Cycle Time
